intro: Pseudobastardia crispa, commonly known as the wrinkled false bastardia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Pseudobastardia crispa is adapted to withstand drought conditions due to its thick, waxy leaf surface.
